tenses.description: Used in formal situations and polite conversation. This is the most commonly used form for polite speech in daily interactions.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は毎日運動します
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I exercise every day

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは素晴らしい仕事をします
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You do wonderful work

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は料理を上手にします
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He cooks well

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは週末に買い物をします
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We go shopping on weekends

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは宿題をちゃんとします
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You do your homework properly

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは一生懸命勉強します
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They study hard

tenses.description: Used to politely express that an action does not happen or is not done. Common in everyday polite conversation.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は肉を食べません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I don't eat meat

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたはそんなことをしません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You don't do such things

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は嘘をつきません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She doesn't tell lies

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは無駄なことをしません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We don't do wasteful things

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは心配しません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You don't worry

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは約束を破りません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They don't break promises

tenses.description: Used to express past actions or completed events in polite speech. Formed by changing 'ます' to 'ました'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は昨日たくさんの仕事をしました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I did a lot of work yesterday

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは素晴らしい発表をしました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You gave a wonderful presentation

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は昨夜料理をしました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He cooked last night

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは先週旅行をしました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We traveled last week

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは試験の準備をしました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You prepared for the exam

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは会議で重要な決定をしました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They made an important decision at the meeting

tenses.description: Used to politely express that an action did not happen in the past. Common in polite conversation about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は昨日何もしませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I didn't do anything yesterday

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたはそのミスをしませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You didn't make that mistake

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は約束を忘れませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She didn't forget the promise

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちはその仕事をしませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We didn't do that work

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは問題を起こしませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You didn't cause problems

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは諦めませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They didn't give up

tenses.description: Used in casual conversation with friends, family, or in informal situations. The casual form of 'します' is 'する'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は毎日運動する
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I exercise every day

conjugations.exampleSentence: 君はいい仕事をする
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You do good work

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は料理が得意だ
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He's good at cooking

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕たちは週末に遊びに行く
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We hang out on weekends

conjugations.exampleSentence: お前らは宿題をちゃんとやる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You guys do your homework properly

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは頑張って勉強する
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They study hard

tenses.description: Used in casual conversation to express that an action does not happen. Formed by changing 'する' to 'しない'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕は肉を食べない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I don't eat meat

conjugations.exampleSentence: 君はそんなことをしない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You don't do such things

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は嘘をつかない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She doesn't tell lies

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕たちは無駄なことをしない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We don't do wasteful things

conjugations.exampleSentence: お前らは心配しない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You don't worry

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは約束を破らない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They don't break promises

tenses.description: Used to express past states or conditions in casual speech. Formed by changing 'する' to 'した'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 昨日たくさんの仕事をした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I did a lot of work yesterday

conjugations.exampleSentence: 君はいい発表をした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You gave a good presentation

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は昨夜料理をした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He cooked last night

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕たちは先週旅行をした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We traveled last week

conjugations.exampleSentence: お前らは試験の準備をした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You prepared for the exam

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは会議で決定をした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They made a decision at the meeting

tenses.description: Used in casual speech to express that an action did not happen in the past. Formed by changing 'しない' to 'しなかった'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 昨日何もしなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I didn't do anything yesterday

conjugations.exampleSentence: 君はそのミスをしなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You didn't make that mistake

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は約束を忘れなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She didn't forget the promise

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕たちはその仕事をしなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We didn't do that work

conjugations.exampleSentence: お前らは問題を起こさなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You didn't cause problems

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは諦めなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They didn't give up

tenses.description: A connecting form used for sequential actions, requests, and as a base for other conjugations. Essential for linking verbs and creating complex sentences.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 仕事をして、それから休みます
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I'll work, and then I'll rest

conjugations.exampleSentence: 宿題をしてから遊んでください
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Please play after doing your homework

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は料理をして、掃除もしました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He cooked and also cleaned

conjugations.exampleSentence: 準備をして、すぐに出発しよう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's prepare and leave right away

conjugations.exampleSentence: 練習をして、試合に臨んでください
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Please practice and face the match

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは相談をして、決定を下しました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They consulted and made a decision

tenses.description: Used to express ability or possibility. Indicates whether someone can or is able to do something.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は日本語で話すことができる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I can speak in Japanese

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは難しい問題を解くことができる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You can solve difficult problems

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は一人で全部できる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She can do everything by herself

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは協力してこの仕事ができる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We can do this work by cooperating

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちなら必ずできる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If it's you guys, you can definitely do it

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは素晴らしい演奏ができる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They can perform wonderfully

tenses.description: Used to express intention, invitation, or suggestion. Often translated as 'let's do' or 'I will do'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 明日から毎日運動しよう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I'll exercise every day starting tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: 一緒に頑張ろう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's do our best together

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼はもっと努力しようと決めた
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He decided to try harder

conjugations.exampleSentence: 今日は早く帰ろう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's go home early today

conjugations.exampleSentence: みんなで旅行しよう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's all travel together

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは新しいプロジェクトを始めようとしている
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They are about to start a new project

tenses.description: Used to express that the subject receives an action from someone else, often with a sense of inconvenience or suffering. Can also express respect or formality.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は先生に質問される
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am asked a question by the teacher

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは上司に批判される
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are criticized by your boss

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は皆に尊敬される
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She is respected by everyone

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは先輩に指導される
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We are instructed by our seniors

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは会社に信頼される
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are trusted by the company

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは社会に評価される
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They are evaluated by society

tenses.description: Used to express making or letting someone do something. Indicates that the subject causes someone else to perform an action.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は子供に宿題をさせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I make my child do homework

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは部下に報告をさせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have your subordinate make a report

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は学生に発表をさせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He makes the students give presentations

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは社員に研修を受けさせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We have our employees undergo training

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは新人に仕事をさせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have the newcomers do work

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは選手に練習をさせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They make the players practice

tenses.description: Used to express a condition or hypothetical situation, meaning 'if' or 'when'. Formed by adding 'ば' to the verb stem.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 努力をすれば、必ず成功する
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you make an effort, you will surely succeed

conjugations.exampleSentence: 練習をすれば、上手になる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you practice, you will get better

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼が準備をすれば、問題ない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If he prepares, there's no problem

conjugations.exampleSentence: 協力をすれば、できないことはない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If we cooperate, there's nothing we can't do

conjugations.exampleSentence: 計画をすれば、うまくいく
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you plan, it will go well

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らが決断をすれば、前に進める
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If they make a decision, we can move forward

tenses.description: Used to give commands or orders. This form is direct and should be used carefully as it can sound rude. Often used in emergency situations or with close relationships.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 宿題をしろ！
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Do your homework!

conjugations.exampleSentence: すぐにしろ！
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Do it immediately!

conjugations.exampleSentence: 集中してしろ！
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Concentrate and do it!

tenses.description: Used to express being made to do something against one's will, often with a sense of being forced or compelled. Combines causative and passive meanings.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は毎日宿題をさせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am made to do homework every day

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは会議に参加させられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are made to attend the meeting

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は難しい仕事をさせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He is made to do difficult work

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは早く起きさせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We are made to wake up early

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは練習をさせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are made to practice

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは長時間働かせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They are made to work long hours

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical conditions or 'if-then' statements. More conversational than the ば-form and often used for natural consequences.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 宿題をしたら、遊べる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If I do my homework, I can play

conjugations.exampleSentence: 練習をしたら、上手になる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you practice, you'll get better

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼が準備をしたら、出発できる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If he prepares, we can leave

conjugations.exampleSentence: 協力をしたら、成功する
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If we cooperate, we'll succeed

conjugations.exampleSentence: 計画をしたら、うまくいく
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you plan, it will work out

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らが決断をしたら、進められる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If they make a decision, we can proceed

tenses.description: Used in formal situations and polite conversation. This is the most commonly used form for polite speech in daily interactions.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は毎朝会社に行きます
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I go to the office every morning

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたはいつも図書館に行きます
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You always go to the library

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は週末に山に行きます
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He goes to the mountains on weekends

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは来月旅行に行きます
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We're going on a trip next month

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちはどこに行きますか
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Where are you going?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは毎日学校に行きます
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They go to school every day

tenses.description: Used to politely express that one does not go somewhere or that an action does not take place.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は今日学校に行きません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I'm not going to school today

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたはそこに行きませんか
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Aren't you going there?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は一人では行きません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She doesn't go alone

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちはその店には行きません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We don't go to that store

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちはパーティーに行きませんか
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Aren't you going to the party?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは危険な場所には行きません
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They don't go to dangerous places

tenses.description: Used to express past actions or completed events in polite speech, specifically for going somewhere.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は昨日デパートに行きました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I went to the department store yesterday

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは先週どこに行きましたか
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Where did you go last week?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は友達の家に行きました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He went to his friend's house

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは夏に沖縄に行きました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We went to Okinawa in summer

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは映画館に行きました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You went to the movie theater

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは海外旅行に行きました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They went on an overseas trip

tenses.description: Used to politely express that one did not go somewhere in the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は昨日どこにも行きませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I didn't go anywhere yesterday

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたはパーティーに行きませんでしたね
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You didn't go to the party, did you?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は体調が悪くて行きませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She didn't go because she wasn't feeling well

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは結局行きませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We didn't end up going

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは会議に行きませんでしたか
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Didn't you go to the meeting?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは天気が悪くて行きませんでした
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They didn't go because of bad weather

tenses.description: Used in casual conversation with friends, family, or in informal situations about going places.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 毎朝会社に行く
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I go to work every morning

conjugations.exampleSentence: 君はいつも図書館に行く
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You always go to the library

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は週末に山に行く
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He goes to the mountains on weekends

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕たちは来月旅行に行く
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We're going on a trip next month

conjugations.exampleSentence: お前らはどこに行くんだ
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Where are you guys going?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは毎日学校に行く
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They go to school every day

tenses.description: Used in casual conversation to express that one does not go somewhere.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕は今日学校に行かない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I'm not going to school today

conjugations.exampleSentence: 君はそこに行かないの
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You're not going there?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は一人では行かない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She doesn't go alone

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕たちはその店には行かない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We don't go to that store

conjugations.exampleSentence: お前らはパーティーに行かないのか
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Aren't you guys going to the party?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは危険な場所には行かない
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They don't go to dangerous places

tenses.description: Used to express past actions in casual speech, specifically for going somewhere.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 昨日デパートに行った
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I went to the department store yesterday

conjugations.exampleSentence: 君は先週どこに行った
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Where did you go last week?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は友達の家に行った
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He went to his friend's house

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕たちは夏に沖縄に行った
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We went to Okinawa in summer

conjugations.exampleSentence: お前らは映画館に行った
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You went to the movie theater

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは海外旅行に行った
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They went on an overseas trip

tenses.description: Used in casual speech to express that one did not go somewhere in the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 昨日どこにも行かなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I didn't go anywhere yesterday

conjugations.exampleSentence: 君はパーティーに行かなかったね
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You didn't go to the party, did you?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は体調が悪くて行かなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She didn't go because she wasn't feeling well

conjugations.exampleSentence: 僕たちは結局行かなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We didn't end up going

conjugations.exampleSentence: お前らは会議に行かなかったのか
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You guys didn't go to the meeting?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは天気が悪くて行かなかった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They didn't go because of bad weather

tenses.description: A connecting form used for sequential actions, requests, and as a base for other conjugations. Essential for linking verbs.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 学校に行って、勉強します
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I'll go to school and study

conjugations.exampleSentence: 駅に行って、切符を買ってください
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Please go to the station and buy a ticket

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は図書館に行って、本を借りた
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He went to the library and borrowed a book

conjugations.exampleSentence: 買い物に行って、夕飯を作ろう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's go shopping and make dinner

conjugations.exampleSentence: 公園に行って、遊んできてください
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Please go to the park and play

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは会議に行って、報告をしました
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They went to the meeting and gave a report

tenses.description: Used to express ability or possibility to go somewhere. Indicates whether someone can go.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は明日パーティーに行ける
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I can go to the party tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは今週末旅行に行けますか
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Can you go on a trip this weekend?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は一人で海外に行ける
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She can go abroad by herself

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは車で山に行ける
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We can go to the mountains by car

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは何時に行けますか
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: What time can you go?

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは来週なら行ける
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They can go next week

tenses.description: Used to express intention, invitation, or suggestion to go somewhere. Often translated as 'let's go' or 'I will go'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 明日早く学校に行こう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I'll go to school early tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: 一緒に映画を見に行こう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's go watch a movie together

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は海外留学に行こうと決めた
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He decided to go study abroad

conjugations.exampleSentence: 今日は早く帰ろう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's go home early today

conjugations.exampleSentence: みんなで旅行に行こう
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's all go on a trip

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは新しいレストランに行こうとしている
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They are about to go to a new restaurant

tenses.description: Used to express that someone's going causes an effect on the speaker, often with a sense of inconvenience or being left behind.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は友達に先に行かれた
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: My friend went ahead without me

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは同僚に置いて行かれる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are left behind by your colleagues

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は恋人に遠くへ行かれてしまった
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: His girlfriend went far away (and he feels the loss)

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは先輩たちに先に行かれた
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We were left behind by our seniors

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは仲間に行かれて寂しい
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You feel lonely because your friends went

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは家族に旅行に行かれた
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Their family went on a trip (leaving them behind)

tenses.description: Used to express making or letting someone go somewhere. Indicates that the subject causes someone else to go.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は息子を学校に行かせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I make my son go to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは部下を出張に行かせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You send your subordinate on a business trip

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼女は娘を留学に行かせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She lets her daughter go study abroad

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは新人を研修に行かせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We send the newcomers to training

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは子供たちを遠足に行かせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You let the children go on a field trip

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは選手を大会に行かせる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They send the players to the tournament

tenses.description: Used to express a condition or hypothetical situation about going, meaning 'if (someone) goes' or 'when (someone) goes'.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 駅に行けば、すぐに会える
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you go to the station, we can meet right away

conjugations.exampleSentence: 早く行けば、間に合う
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you go early, you'll make it in time

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼がパリに行けば、エッフェル塔が見られる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If he goes to Paris, he can see the Eiffel Tower

conjugations.exampleSentence: 一緒に行けば、楽しいよ
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If we go together, it will be fun

conjugations.exampleSentence: 今行けば、セールに間に合う
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you go now, you'll catch the sale

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らが海外に行けば、視野が広がる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If they go abroad, their perspective will broaden

tenses.description: Used to give commands or orders about going somewhere. This form is direct and should be used carefully as it can sound rude. Often used in emergency situations or with close relationships.

conjugations.exampleSentence: すぐに行け！
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Go immediately!

conjugations.exampleSentence: 家に帰れ！
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Go home!

conjugations.exampleSentence: 病院に行け！
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Go to the hospital!

tenses.description: Used to express being made to go somewhere against one's will, often with a sense of being forced or compelled. Combines causative and passive meanings.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私は毎日学校に行かせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am made to go to school every day

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたは会議に行かせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are made to go to the meeting

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼は遠い場所に行かせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He is made to go to a distant place

conjugations.exampleSentence: 私たちは早く出発させられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We are made to leave early

conjugations.exampleSentence: あなたたちは研修に行かせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are made to go to training

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らは海外出張に行かせられる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They are made to go on business trips abroad

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical conditions about going, or 'if-then' statements. More conversational than the ば-form and often used for natural consequences.

conjugations.exampleSentence: 駅に行ったら、友達に会える
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If I go to the station, I can meet my friend

conjugations.exampleSentence: 早く行ったら、間に合う
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you go early, you'll make it in time

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼がパリに行ったら、エッフェル塔が見られる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If he goes to Paris, he can see the Eiffel Tower

conjugations.exampleSentence: 一緒に行ったら、楽しいよ
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If we go together, it will be fun

conjugations.exampleSentence: 今行ったら、セールに間に合う
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If you go now, you'll catch the sale

conjugations.exampleSentence: 彼らが海外に行ったら、視野が広がる
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: If they go abroad, their perspective will broaden
